definition: to look after/to attend to/to have in care
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: Rachel watches Ben while Ross has a meeting, and she teaches him all about practical jokes.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯開會，瑞秋替他照看兒子班並教他惡作劇。

sentences.english: As soon as the baby cormorant breaks the eggs, it is watched by Damin himself.
sentences.chinese: 小鸕鶿一啄破蛋殼，大明就親自照看它。

sentences.english: Would you mind the store for me while I'm out?
sentences.chinese: 你能在我不在時幫我照看一下店嗎？

sentences.english: Do you know how to look after the flowers?
sentences.chinese: 你知道如何照看電子狗嗎？

sentences.english: If you like, I could do something for your baby.
sentences.chinese: 如果你願意，我可以幫你照看孩子。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, it's a case of the fox guarding the henhouse.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，這種做法無異於請狐狸去照看雞窩。

sentences.english: As if attending to these curst cocks and hens here were not enough work for any girl.
sentences.chinese: 好像照看這些公雞和母雞還不夠一個女孩子忙的。

sentences.english: Thanks for looking after the house while we were away.
sentences.chinese: 多謝我們不在的時候幫我們照看房子。
他給臨時來照看孩子的保姆付了錢。

sentences.english: Mary's date for the dance ruled out any baby-sitting that evening.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗跳舞的約會使她不可能在那天晚上替人照看小孩。

sentences.english: All her time goes into nursing her child.
sentences.chinese: 她把全部時間都花於照看自己的孩子上了。

sentences.english: Mothers have traditionally stayed home with their children.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上，母親們留在家裏照看孩子。

sentences.english: The outreach team agreed to look after his dog until he returned.
sentences.chinese: 外展小組同意照看他的小狗，直到他出來。
照看這些曉樹是他們的職責。

sentences.english: But when the pack had puppies, the other adults recruited him to babysit .
sentences.chinese: 但是包讓人招募他照看嬰孩小狗，其它成年人。

sentences.english: Mind your bicycles so as not to be stolen by the thieves hereabout .
sentences.chinese: 請你照看好你的自行車，附近小偷很多，以免被偷。

definition: to tend/to take care of sb
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to look after/to provide for
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to look after
to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
to take care of/to sort out/to manage/to put in order
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to tell/to exhort/injunction
to correlate with/to correspond to
to look after/to take care of/to attend to
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful
to have more work than one can deal with/to have one's hands full
to help out
to guard/to watch over
to serve/to wait upon
to visit/to call on sb/to look around
